}} 'Nuestra SeÃ±ora Santa MarÃ­a de la AsunciÃ³n' (, ) is the capital and largest
city of Paraguay.

The 'Ciudad de AsunciÃ³n' is an autonomous capital district not part of any
department. The metropolitan area, called [[Gran AsunciÃ³n]], includes the cities
of San Lorenzo, Fernando de la Mora, LambarÃ©, Luque, Mariano Roque Alonso,
Ãemby, San Antonio, Limpio, CapiatÃ¡ and Villa Elisa, which are part of the
Central Department. The AsunciÃ³n metropolitan area has more than 2 million
inhabitants. The Municipality of AsunciÃ³n is listed on the AsunciÃ³n Stock
Exchange, as , a unique feature of any city.

It is the home of the national government, principal port, and the chief
industrial and cultural centre of the country.
